hl.seg: Supporting the French proposal

doc.seg: The meeting of the committee took place in the parliament house under the chairmanship of the committee chairman Mushahid Husain Syed, in which they proposed to the government to send a delegation, with representatives of all political parties apart from humanitarian aid to Palestine.

After the meeting, speaking to representatives of the press, Mushahid Husain Syed said that the committee welcomed the proposal given by France, in which it was stated that Israel calls an immediate ceasefire and allow humanitarian work among the affected people of Gaza.
Calling the Israeli attacks on Palestine, a crime against humanity, he said that all countries should derogate these attacks.
Mushahid Husain made the double standards of the countries of the world a target of his attack, and said that why are those who speak against terrorism, quiet about the Israeli attacks on Palestine?
The chairman of the standing committee of external affairs in the senate also targeted the leaders of Muslim nation who were taking a quiet stance on the matter of Palestine.

He said that the committee expressed hope that the newly elected American President, Barack Obama would speak to the Muslim nation, within his first 100 days of his government, to bridge the gulf forming between American and the Muslim nation.

Mushahid Husain Syed said that the gap formed between Muslim nation and the West should be filled by taking not only sudden steps but also by solving long standing issues like that of Kashmir and Palestine.
The minister of foreign affairs, Malik Imad told the committee that he was going to Saudi Arabia to attend the meeting of the foreign ministers of the governments of Islamic countries.

This sudden meeting was called as a result of Israeli attacks on Palestine. He said that he was aware of the Palestinian matter and at present, the government was in contact with the premiers of other countries.
minister of state for foreign affairs has said that the issue of Palestine should be resolved in accordance with the resolutions of the United Nations.
two journalists from Arab countries also joined the conference and they told about the latest situation in Palestine.
in Islamabad, students of the International University demonstrated protest against the Israeli attacks on Palestine.
the protesters were holding banners and placards having anti Israel slogans written on it.

hl.seg: abstention from dieting in order to avoid Flu.

doc.seg: This research from the American Scientists have come up after the experiments on rats.
in has been proven from experiments that rats put on diet with less calories had less ability to resist the Flu virus.
research has proven this old myth wrong that its better to fast during fever.
according to the scientists one should eat a lot during fever.

the researchers from the Michigan State University say that the rats on dieting had less power to resist the infection and their chances of dying had increased whereas rats on normal diet had better resistance against the Flu virus.
Professor Elizabeth Gardner said that those who are dieting are not only sooner affected by the flu, but also take longer to recover.
She also said that those who have taken flu vaccines should also avoid dieting for a few months during the winter.

hl.seg: First nuclear test was done in 1990

doc.seg: Thomas Reid, who worked in the Leur National Laboratory as a weapon designer had written this book with the help of Los Alamos National Laboratory's former Technical Intelligence Director, Danny Staleman.

In this book, called 'Nuclear Express', the political history of the bomb and its spread, both the authors claim that whichever country made an atom bomb either stole the nuclear secrets from another country or they got help from a nuclear power.
Thomas Reid said in an interview with US News, that China tested Pakistan's first atom bomb in 1990, during the term of the Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto.
Thomas Reid said that due to many factors, he is certain that China tested Pakistan's first nuclear bomb.
Among the factors are the design of the bomb, and information he gathered from Chinese scientists.
He further added that that was the reason that Pakistan was able to reply to India's Nuclear test with a nuclear test in just 2 weeks and 3 days.
Thomas Reid reminded that in 1961, Russia suddenly performed a nuclear test, in response to which America took 17 days to preform a test, despite having this bomb for a long time.
He added that the atom bomb that was tested on May 19th 1998 by Pakistan was made very carefully and that Pakistani scientists had complete reliance on it.
When Thomas Reid was asked whether China provided nuclear technology to Pakistan, he said because India was the common enemy of both China and Pakistan.
He said that there was proof available that Dr. Abdul Qadeer Khan used the Chinese design, and later on the documents which were received from Libya also verify this fact.
Upon another question, as to whether joint nuclear testing was common, he said that America had openly performed nuclear tests for England in the deserts of Nevada in 1990.
He said that we also believe that Israel also has access to the results of this testing.
Thomas Reid was also asked about China's nuclear distribution program which is going on.
Upon that Thomas Reid said that China has been providing raw material, guidance and design for the nuclear setup in Asfahan, Iran since 1991.
Apart from this, China provided Iran with the nuclear enrichment plant in Kheraj.
He said that China has been providing Iran, Syria, Pakistan, Egypt and Libya with nuclear technology through North Korea.

hl.seg: The year 2008 was excellent for the media.

doc.seg: This show was made based on Madonna's album 'Hard Candy', and a few songs with Ukraine's gypsy band and Justin Timberlin are included in it.
An old racing car was also kept on the stage.
It was Celine Davon's second most successful show of 2008, profit-wise, in which 236.6 million Dollars were made.
Canadian show 'Taking Chances' toured 24 countries whereas Madonna only toured 17, which was her first world tour in the last eight years.
Jamie King was the director of both shows, and he was also the one who had organized the 'Spice Girls reunion' tour.
Madonna broke her own record of 2006.
In the year 2006, she had earned 193.7 million Dollars in her 'Confession Concerts'.
Pollstar said that the third most successful singer, was Bon Joy, who made 170 Million Dollars.
Bruce Springstein made 166 million Dollars, coming at fourth, and Police was at number five, having made 120.6 million Dollars.

According to this magazine, in the year 2008, very few people in North America attended concerts and song programs. Only those people attended these programs, who were prepared to buy tickets at costly rates.
In America, there was an average increase of eight percent in the price of one ticket. In Madonna's show, the most expensive ticket sold was of 350 Dollars.
The editor of Pollstar magazine, Gary Bongiovanni, said that given the economic environment, the year 2008 was a good year for musicians.
He predicted that the year 2009 would be a good year for Springsteen and U2, whose albums were to be released this year.

hl.seg: Ban on Joint Education: Taliban

doc.seg: The local Taliban of the Hafiz Gul Bahadur faction, in the chief province, Miran Shah and other provinces of North Waziristan have distributed a pamphlet in which the government and semi-government institutes in which boys and girl are given joint education were warned.
In the pamphlet, it was stated that if the joint educational institutes were not closed by the 5th of January, action will be taken against them.

It was stated in the pamphlet that making identification cards for women, either for government aid or for other educational reasons would be forbidden, and that women would be disallowed from going to identification offices in all provinces.

The local Taliban's announcement of the forbidding of women from making identification cards was made at a time when about 200 women had submitted their forms in North Waziristan for identification cards in the identification offices for the sake of the Benazir Income Support Program.
According to the locals, the pamphlets issued by the local Taliban was read out loud on the loudspeakers of all the mosques in North Waziristan.
However, the letter did not state whether there would be a ban on separate girls educational institutions or not.

According to the pamphlet, after the announcement, if any woman is caught going to a school or an identity office to receive education or to make her identity card, she and her family members will be given punishments according to their law.
Apart from this, the police claim that in Banoo district, on Banoo Meeran Shah road, a gun powder tunnel blasted causing the death of one passenger and injuring another.
The injured was admitted to Banoo civil hospital.

hl.seg: More bodies of target killing received.

doc.seg: According to the police, in the central area of Mengoora, at Green circle, and Sehrab Khan circle, two bodies were found whose bodies were separated from their heads.
It is being said that the dead belonged to the frontier core and the police.
Eye witnesses say that a letter was also found near the bodies, in which it was warned that whoever lifted these bodies before 11:00 in the day, he will be responsible for his own death.
Local people are saying that the two bodies were left in the marketplace till 11:00after which security officers carried both bodies to the hospital.
In the central area of Mengorah as well as other nearby places, a dangerous increase in the number of target killing over the last few weeks has been seen
in which civilians, including women as well as security officers were killed.
According to local sources, until now, more than thirty people were killed in such incidents.
No organisation has accepted responsibility for these deaths yet.

On Saturday, the spokesperson for the local Taliban in Swat, Muslim Khan told BBC that among the bodies found on Friday, three belonged to his companions, among which the body of Dewli's Taliban commander Rafi'ullah was also included.
Muslim Khan said that Rafi'ullah was in the custody of the security forces for the last one and a half months.
He said that when the local Taliban kills anyone, first they send a notice to him, and on the other side a lot of confusion about such incidents occurring in Mengorah, is seen among the civilians.
It is the statement of the local people, that heavy posting of security forces is found in Mengorah, but still, there is an increase on attacks on the civilians.

hl.seg: Benazir honored in a song by Bukhtawar

doc.seg: A rap song (a type of new music), sung in the voice of Bukhtawar is now posted on YouTube.
In this 5 minute song, photos and video clips of Benazir are shown.
18 year old Bukhtawar is a student of Edinburgh University.
She has a deep affection for poetry and singing.
It is said that apparently she started singing pleasure rhymes upon the encouragement from his mother.
Praising her mother, she said that 'She was intelligent and beautiful, she used to do everything in a certain way'.
Regarding the December 27th incident, she said that she was hit near the cheek by a bullet. She left us at the age of 54, leaving behind three children.
The whole nation is desperate without her. She is present in all their hearts.
Bukhtawar is second among Benazir Bhutto's children, to Bilawal Bhutto.
She was always interested in music.

It is being said that before returning to her mother's country, she had asked her journalist friend, in America, to introduce her to Grammy award winning producer and rapper, Puff Diddy, but this meeting could not take place.
The translation of some of Bukhtawar's poetry has been published in some Sindhi newspapers, but her voice is being heard for the first time in a YouTube video.
Some of Benazir Bhutto's party workers and admirers have started making CD's of Bukhtawar's rap song.
On the other hand, Pakistan Peoples Party spokesperson, Farhatullah Babar confirmed that the song and voice present on YouTube is that of Bukhtawar.
He said on phone from Islamabad that this was the salutation of a brave mother by a sad daughter, which even started to play on Pakistan's government TV network.
Farhatullah Babar said that the party had no present plan to distribute CD's of her song.
He said that a few months ago, a fake page belonging to their party's young chairman, Bilawal Bhutto Zardari was created on Facebook which was later removed.

hl.seg: Ajmal Qasab is a Pakistani: Minister for Media

doc.seg: The joint minister of media and publishing, Sherry Rehman told BBC Urdu in an SMS message that he sent, confirming Ajmal Qasab's citizenship as a Pakistani, only that more investigations were going on.
Before this, the internal advisor to the Prime Minister, Rahman Malik had denied his Pakistani citizenship.
It was his saying that the record keeping offices do not have any record of him.
Regarding this new standpoint, it could not be cleared as to on what basis the Pakistani government changes their stand.
However, according to the Foreign Ministry, the confirmation of Ajmal Qasab's citizenship was done by the Home Ministry.
earlier BBC Urdu service and some other newspapers and TV channels have told that Ajmal Qassab belongs to Farid Kot town of the Okara District in Province Punjab.
however the government had been denying it.
it has not yet been established that this Ajmal Qassab does belong to Farid Kot or some other place.

hl.seg: Rockets fired from Lebanon, bombing in answer

doc.seg: the Israeli Army and Police official have told media correspondents that 4 rockets were fired on the Israeli territory from Lebanon out of which one fell in the Neharia town of northern Israel which injured two people slightly.
in answer to the rockets fired from the Lebanese territory, the Israeli artillery has bombed Lebanon.
its is not clear that this attack was carried out by Hizbullah or the Palestinian groups active in Lebanon are behind it.
Lebanese government says that it is also trying to figure out who is behind these rocket attacks.
BBC correspondents have declared that this as a very dangerous turn in the reigning situation in the region.
BBC's editor for Middle East Geremy Bowin has said that due to these rocket attacks is the danger of the war spreading out has increased.
In the last few days, it was being feared that the action going on in Gaza might spread to the Israeli border with Lebanon in the north.
Here, in the night between Wednesday and Thursday, the Israeli army made 60 air attacks on the Gaza strip.
According to Israeli army, in these attacks, the police stations of Hamas, their tunnels, weapon stocks, rocket launching pads, and armed workers were targeted.
Apart from the air attacks, the Israeli army and the naval launching pad also bombarded Gaza all night.
Palestinian sources say that the air attacks have destroyed a mosque in Gaza city.
According to unconfirmed reports, the Israeli army tanks with air support from helicopters moved towards the region of Khan Younus.
In this war that has been going on for the last 12 days, about 700 people among which a large number of women and children are included, have been killed.
On the other side, 11 Israeli soldiers have been killed
Israeli security forces have confirmed that a high defense agent, Amous Gilad is going to Cairo to decide the conditions for ceasefire.
A delegation from Hamas is also going to Cairo to hold simultaneous dialog with the Egyptian diplomats.
Apart from this, the leader of the Palestinian Authority, Mehmood Abbas, is also reaching Cairo on Friday.

hl.seg: My heart is broken, return my kidney.

doc.seg: Dr. Richard Batista says that eight years ago, he had gifted his wife Dawnell his kidney, to save her life.
According to AFP news agency, it is Dr. Batista's statement that his wife has repayed him for his gift by cheating him and having relations with another man, and now she wants divorce.
Dr. Batista said, during an interview to a local newspaper, Daily News, that her love affair has put a hole in my heart that still exists.
According to Dr. Richard Batista's lawyer, though Dr. Batista is demanding his kidney back, but he actually wants a monetary compensation for the kidney.
He will give his stand about his wife in front of a judge within the next few days.

hl.seg: 140 year old, 9 kilo weighing lobster free

doc.seg: 'George the Giant Lobster' was captured from the sea two weeks ago.
The Seafood company of the city had purchased it for a hundred Dollars.
It also immediately started to use the pictures of the lobster for the sake of publicity.
However an animal preservation group, PETA, demanded that they release the lobster, because of which it was released back into the sea.
George was captured from the sea in Canada, after which it stayed in the tank of City Crab and Seafood Company for ten days.
The age of the lobster can be estimated from its weight.
The manager of the restaurant, Keith Valenti said that he did not want to harm the lobster, and he only kept him in the tank for the sake of pleasing his customers.

Animal protection organization PETAIngrid Newkirk said that they applaud the decision of the restaurant which serves as an example to those people who want to confine such intriguing animals to tiny tanks or boil them alive.

hl.seg: The search of a girl by mobile.

doc.seg: When officials came to know about Natalie Maltise, the police and firefighters of Athule city in Massachusetts came alive.
The agents came to know about her exact location with the use of the GPS present in her mobile.
However, with the use of Google Street View, it came to be known that she was in a hotel.
One week ago, Natalie's grandmother Rose Maltise had taken Natalie away from the supervision of her legal parents.
The Police Chief of Athule, Timothy Anderson told BBC that she said that she will never return Natalie, and she left the state.
The police contacted Mrs. Maltise but when she did not return Natalie, as promised, the police decided to trace Natalie using her mobile phone.

Since 2005, it is a rule in America that the mobile service providers must provide the location of 65% of the callers of more than 100 meters away and that of 95% of the callers of more than 300 meters away.

hl.seg: Hamid Karzai on India trip

doc.seg: This is the second Indian visit for Hamid Karzai in the last 5 months.
It is expected that he will speak to Prime Minister Manmohan Singh about the situation after the terrorist attacks in Mumbai, during this trip.
During this trip, he wants to express the feelings of Afghnistan and its public about the Mumbai attacks, and show its solidarity with India.
Apart from solidarity, Karzai will discuss business during this trip.
It is expected that the mutual help between the two countries, in eradicating extremism will be talked about.
during his last visit to India, president Hamid Karzai said that terrorism will not be let into the relations between India and Afghanistan.
he also said that both India and Afghanistan are facing challenges of terrorism and merciless killings.
peace and stability in both countries, region and whole world is beneficial for everyone.
we understand this reality that both countries and the whole world can only join hands to face this curse of terrorism.
Ajmal Qasab is now in police custody, and it is being hoped that the police will file a charge sheet against him before January 24th.
Ajmal Qasab does not have any lawyer to defend him.
In a letter written to the Pakistani government, Qasab asked for legal aid.
India has give Pakistan proof of the involvement of Pakistani extremists in the Mumbai attacks.
Pakistan has accepted that Ajmal Qasab is a Pakistani civilian.

According to the police case, Ajmal Qasab and his partner Abu Ismail killed 6 police officers including ATS chief Hemant Karkare, Additional Police Commissioner Ashok Kamte and Encounter specialist Police Inspector Vijay Salaskar, after which they fled with their squad car, which was later recovered near DB Marg, Gurgam Choupati.
During police action, Ismail Khan died and the police captured Ajmal alive.
No lawyer was appointed yet, to follow Ajmal's case.
The lawyer chosen by the government, from the legal aid cell, Dinesh Mota refused to accept the case on moral reasons.
Two lawyers pulled out their names after protests and opposition by the people of a political group.

hl.seg: Constitutional Amendment; Committee to be formed

doc.seg: After addressing a seminar on environment change, he told media representatives that for this sake, the parliamentary meeting will take place in which a committee will be formed.

He said that until now, to complete the 17th amendment, the constitutional amendment bill was presented by the Joint National Movement to the National Assembly, whereas other political parties have also presented their constitutional bills in this regard to the parliament.
He said that the Pakistan Peoples Party has also send all the political parties a rough version of the 17th amendment and the committee would analyze their version.
In answer to a question, he said that the parliament would decide the balance of power between the President and the Prime Minister.
The Prime Minister said that the Parliament has the complete right to take any decision.

In answer to another question, he said that in getting the former President retired General Pervez Musharraf to leave his post, apart from the role of political parties, the former Prime Minister and Chairperson of the Pakistan Peoples Party, Benazir Bhutto also played an important role, by forcing the global brotherhood to remove the uniform of President Pervez Musharraf.
He said that the elected Vice President of America, Joe Biden was a supporter of Pakistan and democracy, and that the president honored him in return for his services with the Pakistani Crescent.

Replying to a question about the Indian governments warning of breaking all ties with Pakistan, after the Mumbai incident, the Prime Minister Yusuf Raza Geelani said that the leaders are under extreme pressure from the public, which is why they issue such statements.

hl.seg: Protest against the removal of journalists

doc.seg: On Tuesday the organization of journalists, RIUJ held protests in front of the Islamabad Press Club of journalists and newspaper workers against media owners and the government about the news channel and newspapers removing many of their employees.

Speaking to the protesters, senior member of Pakistan's biggest journalist organization, Federal Union of Journalists, C.R. Shamsi said that the politicians who used to protest with us till yesterday on the streets, today they have become rulers and are sitting in the parliament. Fearing a certain lobby of the media owners, they are not doing anything for the rights of the journalists.

He said that the newspaper owners who speak of human rights have made their offices punishment houses and beggar camps, where despite earning millions of Rupees per year, the workers are given meager wages and by removing hundreds of them, they are killing them economically.

An example of this is in front of us of the worker of a private TV channel, Channel 5, in Lahore, who committed suicide over not getting his salary for four months. And even today, due to being unfairly removed or not getting salaries for months, many workers are leading very difficult lives.
He said that there should be firm steps taken against the TV and newspaper owners, and the journalists should put a protest camp in front of the parliament to get their rights.
C.R. Shamsi criticized the governor of Punjab, Salman Taseer, saying that employees were removed from his Urdu Newspaper 'Aaj Kal' staff, without prior notice.
Wheras Junah daily, Khabrein daily, Channel 5, Burns Plus TV and Aaj TV have removed dozens of workers.

Speaking to the protestors, the General Secretary of PUFJ said that today, throughout the country, journalist organizations are observing a black day against the removal of journalists and newspaper workers, whereas journalists will go to the parliamentary session wearing black bands on their arms to get back their rights.
According to Mazhar Abbas, in 50% of the Pakistani newspapers and TV channels the workers and journalists were being exploited, where they work without any agreement.

He said that till now, more than 200 journalists and workers have been removed from newspapers and TV channels, while it is being feared that the owners will remove hundreds more in the present year, making an excuse of the present financial crisis.

Mazhar Abbas said that the journalist movement will continue, until removed employees are not reinstated, the newspaper workers wages fixed by the seventh Wage board award is not enforced, and the salaries for many months payable to TV channels and newspaper workers is not paid.

hl.seg: 11 member cabinet takes oath.

doc.seg: The new cabinet has six ministers from the opposition party of former Prime Minister, Sardar Atheeq Ahmed, the Muslim Conference, two from Pakistan Peoples Party, two from Peoples Muslim League and one minister from the Joint National Movement.
The 11 cabinet members include one lady minister, who belongs to the Ateeq opposition Muslim Conference party.

The joint ruler said that the cabinet will be expanded next week, and it is possible that 12 more ministers will be taken into the cabinet. It should be clear that in the beginning of this month, Sardar Ateeq Khan's opposers removed him from the post of Prime Minister by showing lack of trust, and they made Sardar Ya'qoob Khan the new Prime Minister.
The jurisdiction of these ministers will be announced later on.
On the occasion of oath taking, members of the Peoples Party shouted slogans in favor of former Pakistani Prime Minister, Benazir Bhutto.

hl.seg: 3.5 million users affected by virus

doc.seg: In this virus first detected in October 2008 which is known by names such as Configure, Down and up, Kido
Microsoft has come out with a patch to deal with this virus, but still some 3.5 million computers and memory sticks were affected by this virus.
Experts say that the number of affected computers might be quite large.
To get rid of this, dealers will have to use Microsoft's MS08-067 patch.
Microsoft says that the virus which has affected thousands of computers searches for the Windows file 'services.exe' and injects its code into that.
Then, this virus becomes a DLL type of file, in the Windows system folder.
This virus also creates the name of the file.
It then changes the Windows registration details.
After this virus is activated, it creates a problem, which appears as an HTTP server, and changes the restore point of the machine.
It then downloads files from hackers' websites.
Microsoft claims that this virus has affected computers in various countries.
China, Brazil, Russia, India, America and England are some of those countries.

hl.seg: 'The Demand for a Quick Report on Indian Information'

doc.seg: In an interview with the representatives of the media, after a meeting of the Home Ministry, he said that the given by India
information will help in investigation in these regards.
He said that Pakistan was a sovereign nation and about the investigation on the information received from India, no country's
dictation wuld be accepted.
He said that apart from the information received from India, they was gathering other information as well.
The internal advisor said that the executive institutions have taken 124 members of practically non-existent groups into custody, solely on the basis of the fear of a reduction in peace.
And if any evidence is found against them, action will be taken against them, while innocent people will be freed.
In an answer to a question, he said that no arrested person would be handed over to India, and that action would be taken against such individuals according to Pakistani law.
He said that action would be taken against these individuals according to the law of the FIA.

In reply to a question, he said that the law enforcing agencies in India took 42 days to gather information about the guilty people in th Mumbai incident, so we hope that India, along with the global community will give Pakistan some time to verify this information.
They once again repeated the offer of the government to form a joint investigation team for the research of the Mumbai incident.
Let it be known, that a three member investigation team has been formed in the leadership of the Additional Director General of the FIA. The information about the Mumbai attacks given by India
to Pakistan, is being verified by this team.

The High Commissione of Pakistan in India, Shahid Malik, met President Asif Ali Zardari, in which meeting the president made it clear that if any Pakistani group or individual is found guilty in the Mumbai attacks, action will be taaken against them according to the country law, and no one would be handed over to India. This, when the Indian government is continuously pressuring Pakistan to hand over the guilty people to India.

hl.seg: 'Anything is possible in America'

doc.seg: Mister Obama will take the oath on the 20th of January, to become America's 44th President.
Standing on the steps of the memorial built in the remembrance of the 16th American President, Abraham Lincoln, in Washington and giving a speech to the music concert,
mister Obama said that America is facing the most difficult challenges it has faced in many generations, and that he hopes that America can overcome those challenges.
Abraham Lincoln had got rid of the tradition of slavery from India.
At the same time, Mr. Obama said that it will take time to resolve the problems facing the country, and that the path will be trying.
'But despite this, I believe that the dreams of the founders of this country will remain alive'.
Apart from the Iraqi and Afghani wars, America is suffering from a devastating financial crisis.
Extra normal steps are being taken for the oath taking ceremony.
Organizers believe that 2 million people will attend the function.
Monday is a national holiday in America, as on that date, the great standard bearer of human rights, Martin Luther King was killed.
Martin Luther King was black.

hl.seg: Salutation to Martin Luther King, a resolution to work.

doc.seg: Dr. Martin Luther King was killed in the year 1968.
Barack Obama saluted Martin Luther King and told the Americans that they would work together to fulfill the promises of this nation.
Here, in Washington, preparations are being made for an unprecedented gathering of the public, for the oath taking ceremony by the new president on Tuesday.
It is believed that near 2 million people will gather in Washington to watch the historic oath of presidency by the president.
Barack Obama started Monday by visiting a medical center in North Washington, where he met with injured American soldiers. After this, he visited a home for the homeless, and painted a wall.
Speaking to journalists, Barack Obama said: "After the present crisis which we are facing, and the difficulties that many people are undergoing, we cannot sit quietly".
He said that Martin Luther King spent most of his for the people.
Barack Obama said: "Today, we are remembering and respecting him, so it is not a day for us to stop and think. It is a day for us to act".
He said that the ceremony on Tuesday would be on the same path as that of Martin Luther King's 'My Dream' speech, to hear which many thousands of people gathered, in 1963.
In this speech, Martin Luther King said that the day will come when people would not be preferentially treated based on their color.

BBC's Mathew Price said that you can call it the patching up of history, that Martin Luther King Day came twenty four hours before the first black president in American history would take the oath of office.
In many of the southern states of America, Barack Obama's presidency is the interpretation of Dr. Martin Luther King's dream.

hl.seg: was the additional political agent.

doc.seg: The additional political agent was kidnapped ten days ago from south Waziristan by unidentified masked men.
Sources say that the agent was kidnapped by the Mulla Nazeer faction of local Taliban.
According to the local government, around 4 o'clock in the evening, Tuesday, the Additional Political Agent of South Waziristan, Aamir Latheef was brought to Wana Scouts camp, by a group of tribals.
However, they did not reveal who had kidnapped the additional political agent.
However, the locals are saying that the political agent was kidnapped by the Mulla Nazeer faction of local Taliban.
Aamir Latheef was kidnapped when he was going from Wana to Tank.
On the 11th of January, 2009, seven masked men kidnapped the additional political agent, Aamir Latheef, along with his driver, from the tribal area, Karkandah of South Waziristan.
According to the government agent, the kidnappers first disarmed the guards, and after that they seated the additional political agent in another car, and took him away from there.

According to the local government, after the kidnapping of the additional political agent, security forces guarded all the check posts in South Waziristan and semi-tribal areas, and the people coming and going were searched thoroughly, and from the previous one week, the rulers have placed economic restrictions on Wana.

On the 8th of December, 2008, the Assistant Political Agent of North Waziristan was kidnapped when he was going to celebrate the Eid vacation from Meer Ali to Banoo, and a few days later, two people, including District Officer Amanullah were killed by unidentified masked men.

hl.seg: A Britain hacker's victory in court

doc.seg: A 42 year old England citizen admitted to hacking websites of the American army.
Gary is suffering from Asperger syndrome. It must be known that patients suffering from Asperger syndrome have strong inclinations to do one certain thing.
His lawyers said that if he is handed over to America, it is possible that he will commit suicide.
However, government advocates claim that there are very few threats to Gary's life.
Lord Justice Morse and Mister Justice Simon said, while declaring the judgement, that Gary is given permission to ask a second chance from the Court of England.
They further said that the Home Secretary did not study the matter.
However, the government advocates claimed that the Home Secretary had used his rights.
Gary never denied hacking the American army website.
Gary had hacked the American computer system in 2001 and 2002, because of which the American government suffered a loss of 800,000 Dollars.
Gary hacked 97 computers, including those of the American Navy and NASA.
However, Gary says that he did not hack with any wrong intent, but was searching about extra terrestrial creatures, which he believed that the American government had kept secret.
Gary's mother, Jane Sharp said that she is happy with this decision.
Gary's lawyer said that this was a correct judgement.
This case was running since 2002, and finally a correct judgement was passed.

hl.seg: Two Hizb commander dead.

doc.seg: The spokesperson of the Northern Command of the Indian Army, posted in Jammu, Lieutenant Colonel Acharya told BBC that "24 National Rifles and Jammu police officers surrounded the parts of the Butty House woods in Gandoh province of Dodah district, in which the militants were supposed to be hiding, according to a confirmed report.
They fired at the army and in the fire back, two armed extremists were killed.

The spokesperson said that among the two killed extremists was the district commander of the 12 year banned organisation, Hizbul Mujahideen, which is active in the region, Zuhoorud Deen Khande, who was an expert at gunpowder blasts.
His companion was identified as Sajjad Husain who joint the extremists last year, according to the army.

According to Acharya, operations are still continuing in the mentioned jungle region, as according to him, there is the possibility of more extremists being present there. According to the army, two Kalashnikov rifles were also recovered during the first stage of the operation.
Yesterday, state police chief, Kuldeep Kumar Khudda released the stats for 2008, saying that this was the most peaceful year so far.
It is worth mentioning that no violence was reported in the seven stage assembly elections that took place in November and December.
More than 1350 contestants took part in these elections.
It should be known that Hizbul Mujahideen is active in Jammu and Kashmir for the last 18 years.
Hizb called a one sided ceasefire for the first time in July 2000, after which the Indian government and Hizb commanders held dialogs.
However, the ceasefire came to an end within 15 days.
Since then, many Hizbul Mujahideen commanders were killed in operations.

On Thursday, the renowned daily, 'The News' wrote about the extremist groups operating in Pakistan occupied Kashmir, that Lashkar-e-Taiba and Hizbul Mujahideen have decided to revise their Kashmir policy.
It should be clear that the policy of both groups until now, has been that the Kashmir issue could be resolved through armed resistance.

hl.seg: Bugthi hill: Gas Pipeline Blown up

doc.seg: According to police officials, the Eighteen inch diameter pipelines running from Loti Gasfields to Peer Mountain were blown up in a blast.
This pipeline was going towards Soui Plant.
In this meantime, a man named Sarbaz Baloch, claiming to be the spokesperson of banned organisation, Baloch Republican Army, took responsibility for the attack over the phone.
This is the fourth gas pipeline being blown up in 4 days.
On Friday, In Allah Yar hill, an eighteen inch diameter pipeline was destroyed to fix which work was going on till Sunday morning.
In Quetta, the Soui Sidran Gas Company's General Manager Mushtaq Siddiqi said that this gas was sent through this pipeline after the afternoon.
This pipeline comes to Quetta via Sabi.

In Quetta, Ziyarath and other far off regions, there is an acute shortage of gas for the last three days. On one hand, it is continuously snowing and the temperature has fallen below freezing point and on the other hand, the heaters and stoves have gone cold.
Apart from this, in Derahbagti town, there was a motorcycle blast in the market, but according to the police, there was no loss of life in the blast.

hl.seg: Administrator for Jamaa'athud Da'wah

doc.seg: The central headquarters of Jamaa'athud Da'wah is in Taibah, about 25 kilometers from Karachi.
This center includes a hospital, a school and a hostel for students.
The law minister of Punjab, Rana Sanaullah Khan says that supervisors were appointed in the center of Jamaa'athud Da'wah, so that the work of social institutes there goes on unaffected.

According to Khalid Waleed, son in law of the Jamaa'athud Da'wah chief, Hafiz Saeed, a high ranking government officer, Khaqan Babar, was appointed for the supervision of the hospital, school and other social institutes, based in the center, as the administrator, while according to him, the posting of police at the center was also increased.

The Security Council has passed a ban on Jamaa'athud Da'wah, after which the Pakistani government has started taking action against Jamaa'athud Da'wah across the country, and has put the chief of the Jamaa'ath, Hafiz Saeed along with other leaders under house arrest. The appointment of the administrator in the Taibah center by the Punjab government was also a part of the action being taken against Jamaa'athud Da'wah by the joint government.
Khaqan Babar belongs to the DMG, i.e. District Management Group.

Hafiz Khalid Waleed said that the Commissioner of Lahore division, Khusroe Pervez Khan along with police and the civil government came on Sunday and inspected the Taibah center. Khalid Waleed spoke ill about the appointment of an administrator, by the government in Jamaa'athud Da'wah, and he said that the number of patients in the hospital and children in the school had already dropped due to government actions.

According to a press release by Jama'athu Da'wah, here, the Jama'ath chief, Hafiz Saeed is said to have written a letter to the United Nations General Secretary, Ban Ki Moon, and the Committee on Taliban, appealing to remove the ban on Jama'athud Da'wah, passed by the Security Council.

In the letter, he mentioned that the passing of the ban by the Security Council on Jama'athud Da'wah, was a one-sided and unjust decision, and that Jama'athud Da'wah has no connection with terrorism, and rather is busy in social work.

hl.seg: Aidhi's Gaza humanitarian mission

doc.seg: After passing many stages involved in getting the permissions required for entering Gaza, he has been successful in reaching Egypt from New York.
Speaking to BBC Urdu service from Cairo, he said that he was not able to reach Gaza yet, as Egypt and Israel have placed many barriers.
He said "It has been eight days since I got here, and I have still not got the permission to enter Gaza."
"I am now in Cairo, and hopefully I will be permitted to reach Gaza tomorrow".

Giving details, he said: "At first, I was given a seven day visa to enter Gaza, and later on, upon insisting, the Pakistani officials helped me out and increased it to a one month visa, but on the condition that I would go only once, i.e. it would be a single entry visa.
He said that he had brought his son and daughters with him, and that they wanted to do some social work.
"I have brought some money".
A one million dollar check has been given to Red cross of Egypt and ten thousand dollar cash is also given in order to send aid to Gaza.

hl.seg: four more ministers in the cabinet, total of sixty three

doc.seg: four new federal ministers include two from Mutahida Qaumi Movement and Two from Jamiat Ulamae Islam Fazalur Rehman Group.
president Asif Ali Zardari took oath from the new ministers.
in the oath taking ceremony, the Prime Minister Yousuf Raza Gilani and members of cabinet were also present.
after the inclusion of four new ministers to the federal cabinet, the number of Federal ministers, ministers for state and advisors has reached a total of sixty three.
two minister from MQM include Farooq Sattar and Babar Ghouri whereas ministers from Jamiat Ulamae Islam Fazalur Rehman Group include Azam Swati and Molana Ataur Rehman.
the departments of these ministers have not been announced yet.
Farooq sattar is the convener of MQM whereas Babar Ghouri is a senator from MQM whose term wil expire on tenth March.
Azam Swati was elected as a free senator and is considered to be one of the richest senators.
Moulana Ataur Rahman is a member of the National Assembly and is Moulana Fazlur Rahman's younger brother.
It should be remembered that four important officeholders are not members of the National Assembly.

It should be clear that on 3rd December, 2008 28 new ministers and 18 ministers of state were taken into the cabinet. At that time it was believed that members of the MQM would also be included in the cabinet, but due to a difference in the distribution of ministries, MQM was not included.

hl.seg: Balochistan pipe line blown up.

doc.seg: According to the police, this was an eighteen inch wide pipe line that goes to the various wells in the gas plant of Peer mountain, and it was blown up by unidentified individuals in the morning.
Apart from this, yesterday, well number three was destroyed in a blast and a gas pipe line was harmed by a blast near Allah Yaar hill.
The responsibility for these blasts were claimed by the spokesperson for the banned organization, Baloch Republican Army, Sarbaz Baloch.
From the beginning of the year 2009, there was an increase in the number of extremist incidents.
In this month, there were dozens of incidents of gas pipes being blown up, and there were also an increase in attacks on trains and people from the state of Punjab.

Though the Chief Minister of Balochistan, Nawab Aslam Raeesani, expressed distress over these incidents, and the police were instructed to share information with intelligence agencies, but it was still not possible to stop these incidents.

hl.seg: The 819 trillion Dollar economic reform package was accepted

doc.seg: No member who was part of any Republican party voted for this plan of President Obama.
It was the saying of the Republican parties, that this economic plan was very expensive and that it would not be successful.
Among the representatives of the houses, 240 votes were given in favor of the plan, while 188 votes were given against it.
This economic reform plan has to be produced in the Senate next week, where the ruling Democratic party has a very normal majority.
It is being feared that due to opposition from the republican party, it's passing in the senate may not be easy.

After the passing of the economic reform plan among the representatives of the houses, Barack Obama said to the members, forcing them, that they should not let political differences get in the way of this important plan.

The President said that plan, which he hoped would become law by next month would prove helpful in creating a suitable environment in the country, because of which business would prosper in the country.

According to this plan, the common man and the businessmen would be relieved of 275 trillion Dollars of debt, and 540 trillion Dollars would be given for fixing roads, bridges and ten thousand schools and for unemployment allowance and research on new technology.

The editor of BBC in Washington, Richard Lister said that Barack Obama had decided to put political differences behind his back and prepare a new political culture, but this economic package has once again created bitterness on political lines.

The Republican party members, among the representatives of the senate, called the proposed bill a waste of government money, and they said that it will not help in creating new employment opportunities.
They stressed upon the bill passed by their party, in which more importance was given to tax cuts.
They said that more employment opportunities could be formed with less capital through their bill.
They said that compared to constructive plans, more employment opportunities could be formed through tax cuts.

hl.seg: Bitterness between Israeli President and Turkish Prime Minister

doc.seg: Recep Tayyip Erdogan told the Israeli president, almost screaming, that the blood of many humans were spilled in Gaza, and it saddened him to see that people could watch this armed killing from Israel and clap in agreement.

Mr. Erdogan said that "I believe that you are using such words to erase your guilty feeling, and outloud, that too. But you killed those people, and I am remembering those children who were killed near the shore."
Simon said that Gaza's calamity is not Israel, but Hamas, who have established a dangerous dictatorship over there.
A BBC journalist from Davos said that he had never seen such a scene in an global economic forum before.
However, Erdogan later stated that he respected the Israeli president and his age, which is why he did not scream at him, but whatever he was saying was very far from the truth
Turkey is one of the few Islamic countries which have diplomatic relations with Israel, but for the last few years there has been tension between them.

hl.seg: The attacks were not planned in Pakistan.

doc.seg: Speaking to Indian news channel, NDTV, Wajid Shamsul Hasan, said that the report of the Pakistani investigations into the Mumbai blast will be prepared soon.
In the attacks that took place in Mumbai, last Novemeber, more than 170 persons were killed.
India claims that the responsibility for the attacks belongs to the extremist group, Lashkar-e-Taiba.
India also said that Pakistani 'state factors' were guilty in the Mumbai attacks.
After the Mumbai attacks, the relations between the two countries were affected.
The high commissioner Wajid Shamsul Hasan gave his first statement about the report of the Pakistani investigations, from which it becomes evident as to what is within the report.
Wajid Shamsul Hasan said that as far as investigation has gone, Pakistani land has not been used.
It must be some other place, not England either.
These were the two places (Pakistan and Britain), about which I was in doubt.

India and the global brotherhood has put considerable pressure on Pakistan, to take action against the perpetrators of the Mumbai attacks. Pakistan says that it has arrested dozens of people during the action against groups which were clearly involved in the Mumbai attacks.
Wahid Shamsul Hasan said: We are not trying to cover this up.
We believe in acting upon facts.
Our investigations will be accepted by the world.
We will try to satisfy India with the results (of the investigation).
Defending the delay in the Pakistani investigations, he said that to gather, understand and verify such matter takes time.
High Commissioner Wajid Shamsul Hasan said that India took 45 days to hand over its dossier.

hl.seg: Black person chosen as Republican leader as well.

doc.seg: In the sixth round of elections of the Republican party, Michael Steele,who got 91 votes out of 168, won.
In the selection for the post of Chairman, the candidate opposing Steele, Katon Dawson got 77 votes, whereas the ex-Chairman Duncan withdrew from the competition in the second stage.
Newspaper writers say that among the five candidates who stood for the chairmanship of the Republican Party, Michael Steele was considered the most moderate leader.

After winning, Michael Steele said in his speech, 'We are going to tell our friends and foes together, that you can join with us, but whoever wants to spoil this, they should be ready to be separated from us'. Michael Steele is from Maryland, where he was Deputy Governor.
He rose to fame in 2006, when he stood in the voting for a seat of the senate.
But after losing in the voting for the senate seat, he became the chairman of the Political Conservative Committee of the party.
Now, after being selected the chairman of the party, the country wide projects of the party will be under his supervision.
He fought in the election, promising that he would take the party in a new direction, and that he would use new techniques to join old-fashioned supporters with the party.

hl.seg: The Indian claim of the presence of Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaysh-e-Mohammad in Jammu

doc.seg: There are reports of the presence of militants in the Ponch province of Jammu
According to government sources, upon receiving secret reports, the police and the army have surrounded the region and have started searching.
In this period small fights ensued in which four militants, two soldiers and one police agent were killed.

According to sources these fights were going on until the last reports received, and Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaish-e-Mohammad militants are present in these regions, to fight with whom more army battalions were sent there.

Meanwhile, the chief minister selected by the joint government, Umar Abdullah met the governor and informed him about his being selected the leader of his party, the National Conference in the assembly.
The allied party of the National Conference, the Congress also informed the governor of their support for Umar Abdullah.
Umar Abdullah will be administered the oath as the chief minister of the state tomorrow.

Note that in the recently held state elections, the National Conference got 28 out of the 87 seats of the parliament, coming forth the biggest party. It should be clear that separatist groups boycotted the elections.
Congress, which got 17 seats, was prepared to form a joint government with the National Conference.
Today, upon reaching Srinagar, Umar Abdullah was jubilantly greeted by the party members.

On this occasion, Umar Abdullah said that he would try to play a role in generating dialog between the Indian government and separatists. However, this would not be possible until the elections took place and the new government came to power in India.

hl.seg: The role of the European Union in peace making in the Middle East.

doc.seg: If looked at from a government perspective, of the diplomatic efforts going on to stop the Middle East war, those of the European Union are the most decisive.
According to the state policy of Brussels, the efforts of the Shwarzenburg delegation or those of Sarkozy, is similar to giving a helping hand.
The spokesperson of the European Commission, Amadeu Altafaj, said that every effort which helps advancing the joint message of the European Union to the two parties, is welcome.
As far as the state policy is concerned, everyone seems alright.
However, in reality, the European Union is in a sad state of internal differences from the inside.
As the president of the Union, the Czech Republic's role is weak, to start with.
On top of that, internal fighting has made it all the more helpless.
On the other hand, French President, Sarkozy's demeanor is such that one would think that he was the president of the Union.
Though France has completed it's 6 month presidency period.
Sarkozy wants to play a presidential role, and he is able to, but he does not have the permission to do so.
the most funny situation is faced by the French foreign minister Bernard Kouchner.
he is part of a delegation which is headed by the foreign minister of Czech republic Schwarzenberg.
the problem is that both foreign ministers are issuing contradictory statements over the Middle East war.

Schwarzenberg says that Israel has the right for self defense whereas Kouchner says that this cannot be considered as a war for self defense. moreover Germany has sent its special ambassador to Middle East. Unless the European Union does not show unity based on common stance, it can not succeed on the diplomatic front.
its proof is the Israeli behavior which does not care about the efforts for reconciliation from the European Union.
this is a golden chance for the European Union to do something since America due to the policies of George W. Bush has already failed in the Middle East.

hl.seg: Financial Crisis: Suicide of a billionaire German industrialist.

doc.seg: Adolf Merckle, a resident of Sawabia in Southern Germany left a huge business group behind him.
but a short while ago, common German citizens did not know much about it.
when he had to negotiate with 30 banks who lent money to his industrial group, he became the topic of the headlines and he could foresee the murky future of the Merckle group.
The Merkle group had to face a loss of a few hundred million Euros due to the arrival of the financial crisis after it bought shares in the German car manufacturing company, Volkswagen.
Financial institutions then refused to give it the new 700 to one Billion Euro loan it needed on an immediate basis, so Merkle went into deep pressure.

Some time before that, the same bank was prepared to give it the immediate loan that it needed, but Adolf Merkel had got to this position from being a small producer, to having a yearly turnover of nearly 30 billion Euros, so he could not bear to lose his capitalistic powet.
After the death of his father, when Adolf Merkel took over his family business, he developed it quick, putting it on new lines.
He called his company Ratiopharm, which is a very successful and large pharmaceutical company in Germany.

Until a while ago, the value of this business was between 5 and 6 billion Euros, and it still earns about 8.1 billion Euros a year.After the superb success of Ratiopharm, Merkel group started buying many other institutions which included construction supply manufacturing companies like Hydelburg Cement to car manufacturing companies like Kassbohrer.
The number of employees of the Merkel group around the world is near 100,000 and its foundation company, the pharmaceutical Ratiopharm always had special importance.
Adolf Merkel has said many times in his life: "It has been four generations since I started making medicine.
Now the management of this group is in the hands of my children and I hope that the mangement of this company will remain in my family for a few hundred years.

After the suicide of Adolf Merkel, banks have sanctioned 400 million Euros in floating loans for his group, but under the condition that VEM will have to sell Ratiopharm so that it could improve its financial conditions in the long term.
Like this, after the death of Adolf Meerklay, the Meerklay group will not remain the same as it was.

hl.seg: Crime rate among the immigrants in Germany.

doc.seg: According to the fresh statistics, crime rate among the immigrants from 2004 to 2007 is
Reduced from 9.22%
According to Joachim Herrmann, the interior minister of Baweria province, this is apparently a positive change.
He said: "It is important to note that the number of foreigners getting German citizenship is increasing.
Therefore this should also be mentioned in the statistics that even though the criminal is German but his background is foreign.
Herrmann said that his province will take this in to account when gathering statistics in 2010.
Besides Baweria, Hamburg is also thinking in the same lines.

The internal affairs senator related with the matters of CDU, Cristoph said: "When research is done in a scientific manner, Ahlhaus, man can not bring about its required results as it wills, but rather, it depends on the numbers and statistics that come out from the research.

He referred to a crime prevention state wise objective report, Ahlhaus, which was prepared in 2006, and on the face of which he researched this. It was reported as to what percent of the people committing crime from Bergdorf to Hamburg were foreigners.
From the results, it became clear that the foreigners there
had a lower crime percentage than the crimes taking place in the whole state.
Contrary to this, during 2006, when the percentage of youngsters committing crimes was calculated, it became evident that the youngsters from a foreign background committing crime was 44
.7 percent.

However, the various German political parties such as SPD, environmentalist party, grains, and left wing party Linkspartei is against finding out during the collecting of crime statistics, as to which German citizen is of foreign background.

hl.seg: We want quick evacuation of the army from Gaza, Olmert

doc.seg: Aihud Olmert stressed that for complete evacuation of forces, a proper and stable ceasefire would be necessary.
Hamas and Israel announced a ceasefire on Sunday.
Islamic militant group, Hamas has said, announcing a one week war break, that the Israeli army should evacuate the Gaza strip within one week and stop their guarding of the strip.
On the other side, Hamas leader Ismail Junaih has said that Israel has received victory in the Gaza war from God.
He said that Israel was unsuccessful in achieving their goals in the Gaza war.
Before that, in Sharm-el-Shaikh in Egypt, on Sunday, the leaders of Arab and European countries had a meeting in which there was a call for immediate evacuation of Israeli army from Gaza.
It was decided in the meeting, that soon, an international aid conference for Gaza would be held.
German Chancellor, Angela Merchel was also present in the mentioned meeting.
At least 1300 Palestinians including 10 soldiers as well as 13 Israelis were killed in the three week long war being fought between the Israeli and Hamas soldiers.
On the other side, Palestinian President, Mahmood Abbas stressed upon an international rule in the Palestinian regions.

hl.seg: Al-Qaida's video message to Germany

doc.seg: In this thirty minute video, a man wearing a black turban, covering his face and holding a gun in his hand addresses the German government.
This man is introducing himself as Abu Talha and speaking in German language.
Arabic sub-titles of this video message are also there.
on the side of the screen is the logo of Al-Qaida and the date written in the video is October 2008.

in this message it is said to the German government that after deploying such a large number of troops in Afghanistan this country is thinking that it will not be attacked, if it's not ingeniousness then what else?
introducing himself as Abu Talha, this man however did not threaten to directly attack Germany.
the number of German troops amongst the Allied NATO forces in Afghanistan is around 3500.
last year the German parliament has approved a bill to send one thousand more troops to Afghanistan.
this is the first message to Germany from Al-Qaida.

having a critical eye on terrorism related issues, the famous expert Mikhail Luders says regarding this message: "the recent suicide attack on the German embassy in Kabul is a proof of the fact that we should take it seriously in any case.
for the past few years Al-Qaida has been issuing video messages on internet and there have been attacks as well after such messages.
On Saturday,the militant organisation, Taliban took responsibility for the suicide attacks that took place outside the German embassy.
Many German newspapers and thinkers are looking at this attack in connection with the Al-Qaidah message.
"They are targeting Germany"
Fundamentalist Muslims are viewing the German Afghan policy in a negative and critical manner.
They accuse the German government of following an extremist policy, not only in Afghanistan, but also in the Middle East.
Because of this, they are considering German as their target, more and more.
In the meantime, the German government claims that the German secret agencies had knowledge about this video, even before it came to light.
The German joint crime control organisation is busy studying the video.

hl.seg: Obama has taken the position of American presidency.

doc.seg: In this setup, let alone the American public, the whole world has different hopes about Obama.
Now that Barack Obama is receiving congratulatory messages from around the world on becoming president, the expectations from him are also becoming clear.
In these regards, German Chancellor, Angela Merchel also expressed reliance on the new American President.
"I believe that the Joint Republic of Germany and the United States of America will be able to get together on the basis of strong relationships and partnership, to solve the problems facing us".
Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin said that Obama seems a serious and open hearted person, and this is definitely something good.
As such, the previous American president's policies were subject to criticism.

However, his government is definitely credited with arousing China into playing a more constructive role on the international level, whereas, with regards to the new president, China has said that he will have to work for strong military ties between the countries.
Expert on Chinese politics, who is active in Bokhum, Germany, Gosuwe Hu, says:

From this viewpoint, I am certain that Obama and his economic team will, within the coming weeks and months, pressurize the Beijing government into pegging the Chinese currency to a stable and market representing exchange rate.
The previous American government also increased ties with India.

About where Obama might take those ties, Professor Christopher Raj, expert on American sciences in New Delhi, says that we are now closer to a strategic partnership, but Obama cannot make any change overnight.
In a message sent to Obama by Pope Benedict, he also stressed upon the need to create an environment of peace and mutual help in the world.

hl.seg: State elections in Israel

doc.seg: This is the first important election in this war ridden country since 2005.
For the state elections, more than 14,400 contestants have entered the arena for 440 seats.
To maintain peace and safety during the elections, 800,000 police and soldiers were posted in Iraq.
Fearing that some bomb blast or terrorist attack might take place on this important day, all the borders of Iraq were sealed one day in advance, i.e. on Friday.
Apart from this, the airport was closed and restrictions were placed on public trasnsport.
According to reports, due to the restrictions on public transport, there was no traffic on the roads of Baghdad, and children were seen playing football on the roads.

During the present Iraqi elections, the security arrangements will tell, on one hand whether or not the local security agencies will be able to take over the country after the return of the American forces from Iraq in 2011, and on the other hand, political analysts are using this as a test as to what extent the public is prepared to bring change to the country in democratic ways.
The state elections are being held with help from the United Nations and almost 800 international supervisors are overlooking the elections.

hl.seg: Today, the Day of Aashura was celebrated throughout Iran in remembrance, respect and honor of the great sacrifice of the chief of all martyrs, Imam Hussain.

doc.seg: According to Mehr news agency, All small and large cities including the capital city of Tehran witnessed the celebration of this day in the respect of the chief of martyrs, Imam Husain, with great respect and honor. On this occasion, the believers gathered in great numbers in such honorary gatherings and remembered the deaths of the Holy Prophet (PBUH) and his family members. Today, the whole country of Iran is mourning the great sacrifice of the martyrdom of the Prophet's grandson, Imam Hussain in the battle field of Karbala. The believers are remembering this unmatched sacrifice and attending such large honorary gatherings in its honor.

hl.seg: Retreat of Israeli soldiers from Ajleen province of Gaza, unmatched forbearance of Palestinian soldiers.

doc.seg: According to the Urdu service of Mehr news agency, even on the 16th day of the fight between truth and falsehood in Gaza, there was beastly bombing by the Israel on the city population of Gaza, by the use of air, land and naval attacks, due to which 880 people have died so far.
Among the martyred are 275 innocent children, who have slept in the lap of death, smiling at the deception of the leaders of Arab countries and of so called human rights organisations.

Today, the always ready to die, Mujahids of Ajeen province have defeated the Israeli army, with the power of faith and martyrdom, and a show of amazing forbearance and steadfastness, tightening the collar of life, around the necks of the Zionist enemies.

If it were not for the deception of Egyptian president, Hasani (not) Mubarak, the brave and loyal Hamas Mujahids would have defeated Israel a long while ago, but apart from the Israeli siege, the Egyptians have also placed Palestinian Muslima under siege, which is the saddest story of Arab history.
Here, the Saudi Arabian and Jordanian governments are giving the Israeli government political and economic support, and are helping Israel by deceiving the helpless Muslims of Gaza.

hl.seg: Barack Obama: America will use a new policy towards Iran.

doc.seg: According to a report from Mehr news agency, the newly elected president of America, Barack Obama told ABC news channel, in an interview with them, that they would take a new approach towards the Iran dilemma.
Barack Obama said that Iran would be a very big challenge for the American government
He said that they are in a dilemma with regards to Palestinian Islamic organizations Hamas and Hizbullah's support of Iran and Iran's nuclear enrichment program.
But he will not retain the policy of present American president George Bush, with regards to Iran, but would adopt different policies for Iran.
Barack Obama said that he would make his actual goal completely clear, while stressing on the hope for mutual respect and dialog.
Barack Obama has mentioned in the past that no prerequisites will be set with regards to dialog with Iran.
During the interview , he expressed the hope that his government would take quick policy decisions on Iran.
Regarding the Middle East crisis, Obama said that he would form a special team
which will start working on establishing peace in the Middle East from the 20th of January.

hl.seg: President George Bush, unable and disliked president Bush accepted his mistakes and crimes in his last press statement.

doc.seg: Mehr News Agency related from Associated Press that the American president George Bush, in the last press conference of his term, accepted numerous of his mistakes and crimes.

Speaking during the press conference at the White House, President Bush said that though newly elected president Obama has the feelings of well wishing, still, the biggest challenge facing Obama would be to prevent possible attacks on America.
He said that the completion of the Iraq mission and social security reforms were his mistakes.
President Bush said that whatever he did, he did it for the sake of protecting America.

Upon being asked various questions about the Israeli inflictions on Gaza, President Bush said that Israel has the right to defend itself. According to him, Hamas does not have the right to defend itself and Hamas should not do anything to Israel, and like America, the whole world should choke the oppressed rather than the oppressor.

The incapable and despicable president of the United States said that Hamas should not be given weapons either, while America is providing Israel the worlds most destructive weapons. Israel is using American weapons to massacre Palestinians and Bush also praised the Israel supporting Arabs, calling them the friends of Israel.
Bush expressed shame at some of the crimes going on in the Abu Ghraib and Guatenamo jails.
People are opining that cases should be filed against Bush for his war crimes, and that the organisations which manage to do this will have done a great service to humanity.

hl.seg: The Iranian President Ahmedinejad expressed sorrow over the silence of the Arab leaders.

doc.seg: According to a report by Mehr News Agency, the Iranian President Mahmood Ahmadinejad criticized the Arab leaders silence on the Israeli inhumanity and oppression on Gaza, expressing his sorrow.

President Ahmadinejad said, expressing surprise over the Arab countries and their leaders silence over the beastly acts of Israel, that Israel is subjecting the Palestinian public to a holocaust. They are making the Palestinian children, women and civilians targets of their barbarianism, and the Arab leaders have not even given one statement.
President Ahmedinejad said that all Arab countries should unite against Israel and save the oppressed Muslims of Gaza from the harm and oppression of Israel.

hl.seg: Ahmadinejad: The king of Saudi Arabia clarify his position on the massacre in Gaza by Israel.

doc.seg: According to a report by Mehr news agency, the President Mahmood Ahmadinejad has told the Saudi Arabian Muslim ruler, King Abdullah, that his silence upon the human massacre in Gaza and not protesting against the killing of innocent children and women in Gaza has become a means of encouragement for the enemies of Islam.

President Ahmedinejad said in his address, that you must clarify your position and support the oppressed openly, so that the efforts of the enemies, to cause differences in the Muslim platform may be unsuccessful.

President Ahmedinejad said in his address, that you know that the human atrocities that Israel is unrelentingly carrying out in Gaza for the last 19 days in which innocent children are being killed, and houses, mosques, schools and hospitals are being bombed in a beastly manner, and the Zionist government is massacring the helpless Muslims in Gaza. In such a situation, if leaders of your caliber remain quiet, it will be a sort of an encouragement for the Israeli leaders.
President Ahmedinejad addressed King Abdullah, saying that non-Islamic countries like Venezuela and Bolivia have taken definite steps against Israel, so only better steps can be expected from you.
President Ahmadinejad said that Palestine will be successful in Palestine.
And the oppressed will be successful over the oppressors, and this is the promise of Allah.

hl.seg: President George Bush: Terrorism is still a threat for America

doc.seg: Mehr news agency reported from German news agencies that American President George Bush said in his farewell speech, addressing his successor Barack Obama and the whole nation, that if compared to seven years ago, America is relatively safe, nevertheless, the threat of terrorism is still floating over the head of America.
Bush said that the enemy terrorists are waiting patiently to attack America, and they have a strong determination to attack America so America should never be unaware about its security.

The American President ignored the hurts and suffering of the hundreds of thousands of Palestinians in Gaza, and defended his policies saying that America is still the biggest supporter country of independence. However commentators do not accept the reality of the unpopular president's remarks, as America is neither a supporter of freedom, nor a supporter of human rights, but rather it is the most mischievous country in the world, which not only supports a blood thirsty country like Israel, but is also directly involved in its crimes.
Israel, openly kills children, women and civilians and the American president is congratulating them. This is the American humanity and freedom which the world is seeing in Gaza and other places.

hl.seg: Usama Hamdan: Presence of army in Palestine continues

doc.seg: According to a report by Mehr News Agency, the Hamas leader in Lebanon, Usamah Hamdan told French News Agency, during an interview, that the one sided ceasefire from Israels side is against the comprehensive international efforts for a ceasefire. He said that as long as Israel is present in Gaza, a one sided ceasefire is meaningless.

He said that the one sided ceasefire was an unsuccessful effort of Israel to escape defeat. Hamdan said that if Israel wants long term peace, it will have to accept Hamas's conditions as well as end this siege.
The Hamas leader in Lebanon made it clear that if Israel tries a one sided ceasefire with its army remaining in the Gaza belt, there will be resistance against it.
Addressing a one way conference from Beirut, the Usamah Hamdan called for the European countries to break ties with Israel.
The Hamas leader said that the increasing numbers of the martyred and injured will only increase our determination.
He told the Palestinian public to stay firmly rooted and resist the enemy like a boulder.

hl.seg: Pakistan: Taliban have killed 6 people in the Pakistani tribal region of north Waziristan.

doc.seg: Mehr news agency reports from Reuters that two Afghan civilians and four Pakistanis were killed after having been accused of being spies, by the Taliban, in the Pakistani tribal region of North Waziristan.
According to reports the local people found four bullet ridden bodies in the Mir Ali province, at the Tahseel circle.
Two more bodies were found at central region Meeran Shah which were disposed of in a market area.
Near the bodies were letters written in Urdu, in which it was claimed that these people were spies.
Two weeks ago, two Afghan natives were killed in the central region of North Waziristan, Meeran Shah, for having been spies.
In the last 12 days, 15 people were killed on the accusation of being spies for America.
It should be known that within the last 6 years, more than 100 people were killed on the accusation of spying, in south and north Waziristan. Taliban is accused of being involved in such cases.

hl.seg: It is expected that president Barack Obama will sign the order for closing down the most notorious Guatanamo Bay jail.

doc.seg: Mehr news agency report sources to say that the American president will sign the order for closing down the most notorious Guatanamo Bay jail.
The new American president, Barack Husain Obama started working on his campaign promises at the surface level.
In this regards, President Obama called for making a plan on calling the army back from Iraq, while the American president will sign an order today, to close the notorious Guatenamo Bay jail.
It is being expected that President Barack Obama will probably sign on the order today, through which the Guatenamo prison will be closed within one year.
Apart from this, the White House is expected to revise suspected terrorism investigation methods and ban ill treatment of prisoners during interrogation.

President Barack Obama started to fulfill his election campaign promises from his first day in office, and first of all started by taking steps towards making the actions and working of the government transparent.

Experts say that the American president has started making efforts to save the falling image of America throughout the world, but that would be difficult for it, because as long as it will keep supporting the blood thirsty Israeli government, it can not be expected to do anything good. Therefore if America wants to save its image, it will have to stop its support of Israel and have to disassociate itself from Israel's crimes.

hl.seg: Tony Blair stresses upon the need to include Islamic organization, Hamas in the talks

doc.seg: Mehr news agency quoted from the Britain newspaper, The Times, that former Prime Minister Tony Blair stressed upon the need to include Hamas in the talks, to bring about peace in the Middle East.

According to the newspaper, Tony Blair said that it is important that a path be found for bringing Hamas into the Middle East peace process. Blair criticized the Bush administration for speaking only to Mahmood Abbas and ignoring Hamas. It should be clear that the western countries have realized the democratic and organizational powers of Hamas and are calling for bringing them into the talks, whereas previously they used to consider it a terrorist organization. A terrorist organization which is trying to defend its country and struggling to save its own house from the clutches of others. Whose house and country have been in the hand of the occupying Israeli government for 60 years.

hl.seg: Murder of Balochistan merchants in Karachi, Complete strike in Quetta

doc.seg: Due to the death of four merchants from Balochistan in Karachi, a complete strike was in effect on Thursday against it, in Quetta and some other places.
In this period all business centers remained closed, whereas traffic was also less than normal.

The protesting strike was called by the 'Anjuman Tajiran Balochistan' (Balochistan Trade Union), Pushtunkhwah Milli Awami Party and the Jamiat-e-Ulama-e-Islam. They accused the Karachi police of having openly fired at these merchants, when they were going by car to their vehicle showroom on Tariq road.
The president of the Anjuman Tajiran, Abdur Raheem Kakad demanded that the guilty police agents should be arrested and action should be taken against them.
However, the stand of the Karachi police about this incident was not immediately clear.
All four of the dead merchants were from the border city of Chaman.
A large amount of security was provided by the government during the strike, and police officers were posted throughout the city, at important locations.

hl.seg: A senior commander of Hamas was killed in Israeli attack.

doc.seg: In an air attack by Israel, a senior Hamas commander was killed.
This is the second death of an important Hamas figure, in the week long Israeli attacks on the Gaza belt.
Hamas officeholders said that Abu Zakariyya AlJamaal was killed in Shujaaiyah palace in the east of Gaza city, on Saturday.
In another air attack by Israel, on Thursday, Aalam Nazar Ra'iyan was killed.
