Hamas's evacuated leader, who stays in Syria, Khalid Mushil has promised to take revenge and warned Israel of launching a land attack on Gaza.
Thousands of Israeli tanks and soldiers are posted at the Gaza border, and they are waiting for orders to attack.
America has called for a ceasefire, but said that it is up to Israel, whether to attack Gaza or not.
American President, George Bush said on his weekly speech on radio, that Hamas was escalating the situation, and he said that their attacks on Israel amounted to terrorism.
He said that America would work for a ceasefire, but any one sided settlement would not be acceptable.

hl.seg: Bodies found in North Waziristan

doc.seg: Pakistani Security officials said that the bodies of three people were found in the tribal regions of North Waziristan.
It is suspected that Taliban gave them the death penalty and killed them.
These bodies were found near the capital city of north Waziristan, Meeran Shah, and such papers were found on them on which accusations of their spying for America were written.
Officials say that perhaps one of these bodies belonged to the local person who was kidnapped last week.
They said that the two remaining bullet ridden bodies belonged to Afghani citizens.

hl.seg: Israeli attacks continue for a tenth day, in Gaza.

doc.seg: Palestinian children injured in Israeli missile attacks. All along the Gaza belt, the Israeli army is fighting against Hamas soldiers, while the Israeli air force is attacking suspected residences of the militant groups, for the tenth continuous day, in the region.
The Israeli defense minister Yahud Barak, said on Monday, that the attacks will continue as long as the people of south Israel are not safe from Hamas rocket firing.
However, despite Israeli attacks, the rocket firing from Hamas's side has continued, due to which four people, including three civilians have died.
Hamas leader Mahmood Zuhr pressured his companions on Monday, to destroy the Israeli army and target Israeli civilians.
However, Hamas leaders say that the organization is planning to send a delegation to Egypt, on Monday, to think over the new developments.
A wounded women in Gaza. Medical sources say that over the last ten days, about 530 people have died, including the 11 people who died on Monday, of which 5 were children.
Israel has reported the death of one soldier and the injury of 30 others in land attacks.
Israel has stopped other-national journalists from entering Gaza, for investigating military action.

hl.seg: The elected American Vice President, Joseph Biden reached Pakistan.

doc.seg: The foreign minister received the elected American Vice President.
The elected American Vice President, Joseph Biden reached Islamabad on Friday, along with his group, for his tour of Pakistan.
The foreign minister, Shah Mahmood Qureishi and the high ambassadors of the American Embassy received him.
Ameican senator Lindsy Graham is also with Biden on this trip.

The Press Officer of the American Embassy, Lou Fintor told the Voice of America that the newly elected President, would talk to the Pakistani government about various regional issues during his tour. However, he avoided giving more detail.
According to sources in the Office of the External Ministry, Joseph Biden would meet with various officeholders in the government, as well as with Army Chief Ashfaq Pervez Kiyani.
It is expected that apart from important bilateral and global issues, matters related to the war against terrorism will also be discussed in these meetings.
Joseph Biden awarded the Pakistan Crescent
After reaching Islamabad, Joseph Biden met President Asif Ali Zardari
During their meeting, in recognition of his efforts in increasing ties between Pakistan and America, the President awarded him with the Pakistan Crescent.

It should be clear that Joseph Biden had introduced a bill along with Senator Richard Logger as the chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee of the American Senate, in which it was proposed that during the next five years there is a tripling in the amount of military aid given to Pakistan, making it 15.7 Billion Dollars.

hl.seg: Joe Biden played an important role in removing Musharraf's uniform, Prime Minister Geelani.

doc.seg: Yusuf Riza Geelani and Joe Biden (File Photo)

The Prime Miniter, Yusuf Riza Geelani said that the American newly elected Vice President played an important role in removing former President Pervez Musharraf from the position of Army Chief, and that Joe Biden helped Democracy in Pakistan considerably.
Yusuf Raza Geelani gave this statement, speaking to journalists in the Karachi shipyard.
He said that Joseph Biden was a Pro-Pakistan leader and as chairman of the committee for foreign relations of the American Senate, he passed a bill for aiding Pakistan with 15 Billion dollars

About the missile attacks by American spy planes within Pakistani boundaries, the Pakistani Prime Minister once more derogated them saying that there is no agreement with the American government about allowing such attacks as according to him, it was a matter of Pakistani sovereignty and hence by no means could they give permission for such attacks within their territory.
he also expressed a hope that after the succession of the new American government, change will come to the American policy as well.
(File Photo)

Yusuf Raza Gilani has said that the government has successfully separated taliban from ordinary tribesmen but the drone attacks have proven to be very harmful to the efforts of the government and the terrorists once again join hands with the local tribes.
he said that the international community agrees to this stance of Pakistan.
Prime Minister added that if reliable evidence is provided, then the Pakistani Forces will operate itself in its own territory.

prime minister yusuf Raza Gilani repeated his stance over Mumbai attacks and said that if India provides evidence, then investigation will be carried out on its basis and if there is any proof of someone's involvement, he will be dealt according to the laws of the country.
while answering a question about Rehman Malik's tour to Britain and his meeting with the MQM leader Altaf Hussain, the Prime Minister said that Rehman Malik went to London on his approval.

hl.seg: Quetta, four policemen including DSP killed.

doc.seg: File Photo
on an important highway of Quetta, Saryab road, firing by unknown people killed four policemen including DSP 'Deputy Superintendent of Police".

On Monday morning, a jeep carrying two DSP's one Sub Inspector and two constables was traveling towards the police training center when two people sitting on a motorcycle near the degree college on Siryaab road started firing at them without any provocation, resulting in the death of Sub Inspector Mehdi, Constable Sibghatullah and Nasrullah died on the spot, while DSP Hasan Ali died upon reaching the hospital.
Hospital sources say that the other injured DSP Ghulam Muhammad's situation is also critical, and he has been shot in the neck and the head.
After the incident, the police have surrounded the area, but as of yet, no one has accepted responsibility for the incident.

hl.seg: The death of another Indian software engineer in America

doc.seg: Another software engineer belonging to Andhra Pradesh has been shot and killed by unknown attackers.
26 year old Akshay Vishal of Secunderanadwas shot two days ago by unidentified assailants in the state of Arkansas. Vishal died in the hospital while undergoing treatment two days later.
He was an employee of Satyam Computers and was providing services for Falcon Jet Airways in America.
In the last one year, seven students from Andhra Pradesh have been killed by American anti-social elements.
The rise in the deaths of those going to America for higher studies and employment from the state has increased the worries of the thousands of families whose children are in America.
It should be known that America is preferred in Andhra Pradesh for higher studies and brighter futures.
According to the numbers and statistics in the American consulate in Chennai, a hundred thousand applications are received for visa every year, of which the most, i.e. 40%, is from Andhra Pradesh.
Meanwhile, the state government tried to bring the murdered person's body to Hyderabad.

hl.seg: Bush: America should be aware of the enemies attack.

doc.seg: In the last weekly speech of President Bush, over the radio, President George Bush warned America to remain wary of enemy attacks.

Mr. Bush said that the biggest threat for Americans is still the possibility of another attack by terrorists. He said that the enemies of the country are patiently waiting, and that they are bent on attacking again.
The outgoing president said that America would definitely have to be aware of its safety at all times.
President Bush also expressed his best wishes for the new president, Barack Obama, who would be taking the oath of presidency on Tuesday.
Newly elected president Barack Obama, in the radio broadcast on behalf of the Democratic party, on Saturday, spoke on the historical importance of the oath taking ceremony.
He said that the oath taking was a custom by which the power is handed over to another leader peacefully has a deep connection with the American greatness.
Mister Obama reminded that around the world, many people can not even imagine the succession of a leader without blood and turbulence.

hl.seg: Meeting of the Sherif brothers and the joint home minister in Raiwand; exchange of thoughts on political and security matters.

doc.seg: The biggest and ruling party of the deferring parties, Pakistan Muslim Leagues (n)'s leader Nawaz Sherif and Pakistan's home minister Rehman Malik met on Sunday in Raiwand in which meeting, Punjabi Chief Minister Shehbaz Sherif was also present.
According to the local media, Rehman Malik probably got an important message from the Pakistan Peoples Party leadership.

However, speaking to journalists after the meeting, Rehman Malik did not disclose anything of the nature and only said that they talked about agreement politics and that he briefed the PML(n) leadership about the conditions after the Mumbai attack.
In his words 'I let them know about the action taken so far'.
It should not be forgotten that a lot of action was taken by the Punjab government and that the team that I formed will need the help of the Punjab government.

Rehman Malik said that every day the media is not told, but PML (n) leadership is sent messages. Here the Pakistan Muslim League (n) spokesperson Pervez Rasheed also spoke, but avoided speaking about some political matters, and said that Rehman Malik has already said what needs to be told.

It should be known that Pakistan Muslim League (n)'s leadership met the Internal Advisor at a time when the state was in a state of hot political activity with 20 or more leaders belonging to the opposition party, PML (q), held a press conference with the Governor of Punjab, Salman Taseer, rejecting the steps of the government in the state and opposing the inclusion of the Governor of Punjab, who is from the Pakistan Peoples Party in this matter.

hl.seg: Obama's speech is glad tidings for Pakistan, President Zardari.

doc.seg: Pakistani president, Asif Ali Zardari welcomed the opening speech of the new President of America Barack Obama, saying that his statement that he would advance the relationship with the Muslim world, based on mutual interests and mutual respect, is a good news for Pakistan and it's public.
In a statement given on Wednesday, he said that the high ideals and values which the American President has promised to uphold gives the people worldwide hope of a new life.

According to the statement, President Zardari said that the responsibility of joining the global brotherhood and searching for roads to peace, development and prosperity, in the 21st century falls, no doubt, on the shoulders of America.

Let it be clear that President Obama said on Tuesday, after taking the oath, in his opening speech, that America wants a new approach towards the Muslim world, based on mutual interests and mutual respect.
He ascertained the people of poor countries that America will work with them to let there be cultural development over there, and to reduce poverty.

hl.seg: President Obama has appointed a special representative to Afghanistan and Pakistan.

doc.seg: Richard Holbrooke the former ambassador to the United Nations, Richard Holbrooke was appointed the special representative to Afghanistan and Pakistan.
Holbrooke played an important role in bringing peace to Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Holbrooke said that he was ready to counsel President Obama on matters relating to Pakistan and Afghanistan.
He added that this would not be easy.
He said that the histories of both countries were extremely different.
George Mitchell was chosen for the Middle East, who will try to blow life into Arab Israeli peace discussions.
Mitchell is an ex-senator and he has played a role in establishing peace in Ireland.
Speaking in the State Department today, Mitchell said that the Middle East situation is unstable, confusing and dangerous.
Nevertheless, America will not step back on efforts to establish peace over there.

hl.seg: Afghanistan: Voter registration in danger.

doc.seg: The Afghanistan Election Commission has said that due to a doubt in safety, it is delaying the voter registration in some of the southern regions.
The voter registration for the upcoming presidential elections had started this week in South Afghanistan.
But the commission has declared that as long as the security conditions do not improve, the voters in some parts of Halmand state will not be able to register themselves.
Extremism has been on the rise in those regions of the south, where Taliban rebels have increased attacks on Afghani and international governments.
In the meanwhile, the Afghani army and the international armies are claiming that during the night between Wednesday and Thursday, during small fights, they killed at least 28 soldiers.
NATO said that its armies had killed 22 soldiers in land and air strikes in the Western province of Khost, near the Pakistani border.
Previously, the Afghan Defense Ministry had said that the Afghan army had killed eight rebels and injured two in the same province.
It is not clear whether the Afghani officeholders are talking about the same incident.

hl.seg: Two missile attacks in Waziristan, at least 18 killed.

doc.seg: Pakistan Intelligence officials have said that in two doubtful American missile attacks in North Waziristan, at least 18 people were killed.
According to the officials, unmanned planes dropped three missiles on a house in Mir province of north Waziristan, due to which ten people in that house died.
According to local officials, five of the dead were non-national soldiers.
This region is considered the center of the Taliban and Al-Qaidah soldiers.
A few hours after this incident, a missile attack was performed on south Waziristan as well, in which at least eight people died.
Despite the objections of the Pakistani government, since mid-last year until now, about 30 missile attacks were done in Pakistan.
The present attacks were the first attacks since President Barack Obama took office.
The Bush government was avoiding to take acceptance for or deny the attacks.
On Friday, suspected American spy planes dropped three missiles in the tribal region of North Waziristan. Until now, five people have died.
The dead could not be identified.
According to initial reports the missile attacks were on a house, in the locality of Mir Ali.
It should be known that these are the first missile attacks on the tribal regions of Pakistan, since Barack Obama became president.

hl.seg: In the state of Sarhad, the officials have rejected the demand of putting a restriction on girls education.

doc.seg: In the state of Sarhad, the officials have rejected the warning to put a restriction on girls education, by the Taliban soldiers, saying that this announcement is against both law and Islam.
On Sunday, the education minister of Sarhad state, Sardar Husain Babar added that the government will never allow such efforts to succeed.
He said that it is the effort of the extremists that the children of our region remain deprived of education.
In his words: "These people try to secretly blow up schools and frighten the boys and girls"
Talking about the environment of fear and insecurity, he said that the local government knows well and wants it to be known that no force can stop the spread of education in the land of the Pukhtons.
One day ago, the Taliban soldiers, led by Moulana Fazlullah had demanded the banning of girls from studying in Swat's educational institutions from the 15th of January.
Despite the military activity going on in Swat, during the last one and a half years, about 150 educational institutions were destroyed by the militants by the use of explosives and arson.
Due to the destruction of these educational institutions, thousands of girls and boys were deprived of the facility of education.

hl.seg: Strict security arrangements in India on Republic Day.

doc.seg: The 60th Republic Day is being celebrated in India on Monday. On this occasion, strict security measures are being taken and thousands of soldiers were posted throughout the country.
On the occcasion of Republic Day, during the army parade in New Delhi, weapons, planes and other military equipment is displayed.

Officials are saying that the security arrangements include anti aircraft missiles and sharpshooters and that police will be deployed to watch the roads of the parade. American President Barack Obama congratulated India on the occasion.
And he also wished Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, who had undergone a heart operation on Saturday, a speedy recovery.
It should be remembered that yesterday the Indian police claimed to have killed two suspected Pakistani militants after a shootout in the outskirts of Mew Delhi.
Local officials say that the police recovered AK 47 rifles, granades and some documents from them which proved that they were from Pakistan.

Police are also investigating whether these two belonged to Pakistani debarred organization, Lashkar-e-Taiba, which was found guilty in the Mumbai attacks carried out in Bombay, November of last year.

hl.seg: Tea: an effective cure for breast cancer

doc.seg: According to a new research, three cups of tea a day,
if taken, can decrease the risk of cancer in women below 50 years of age, by more than a third.

In a research carried out by the Moffitt Cancer Institute, in the American state of Florida, it was revealed that the risk of occurrence of breast cancer tumors, in such women below the age of 50 years
who drink at least three cups of tea a day, is reduced by up to 37%.
It was also revealed in the research that there was no significant benefit, in these regards, in the woman aged above 50, who drank three or more cups of tea a day.
Experts believe that the reason for this is that tea has such ingredients in it, which are more effective against specific tumors which generally occur in women below the age of 50.
In Moffitt Cancer Center, in the city of Tampa, Florida state, a research was conducted on over 5000 women, who had undergone treatment for breast cancer.
Their ages were between 20 and 74 years.
Experts compared their medical records and lifestyles with women who were safe from breast cancer.
The experts also found out that on a specific type of cancer called lobular cancer, the drinking of tea has shown clear effects, and has decreased its occurrence by 66 percent.
A tenth of every breast cancer patient suffers this type of cancer.
This type of cancer is more dangerous because it is deeper and is usually only known after it spreads quite a bit.
Experts say that regular tea consumption, at least three cups a day, can drastically reduce the occurrence of breast cancer in young women.
They say that making tea a regular beverage taken on a daily basis and included in ones daily activities causes the suitable defense required against cancer in the body.
In Britain, every year, approximately 40,000 women are diagnosed with breast cancer.

hl.seg: The biggest military challenge facing the American war in Afghanistan is gas.

doc.seg: American defense minister Robert Gates has said that the war in Afghanistan is the biggest military challenge faced by America.
Gates will give a briefing today to the Senate and Parliament over the strategies of the Obama regime on Afghanistan and Iraq wars.

Gates told the Armed Services committee of the Senate that fight is not the only solution to the Afghanistan issue. But he added that in order to secure several areas, sufficient number of troops is not there, and the Talibans take advantage of that to carry out their activities.

hl.seg: why reduce exercise with the age?
new research

doc.seg: exercise at any age is good for health.
it energizes your heart, reduces the cholesterol level, helps in keeping the weight low, helps in preventing diabetes and slows down the process of Alzheimer or dementia.
unfortunately the ability to exercise reduces in many people with the age.
experts say that exercise keep our body and brain active however age can affect it.
According to the American Medical Association, several health related problems can arise by not doing exercise.
Dr. Patricia Palecca of Mayo Clinic, Minnesota says that an increase in age is a major cause of inability to excercise and lack of bodily activity.
Dr. Patricia teaches medicine at Mayo Clinic.
She lead a study of how heart related diseases and the ability to exercise is related to old age.
The team of doctors used high frequency sound waves to measure the working of the heart.
In which the pumping of the blood by the heart, its contraction and relaxation was studied.
The experts focussed on the left part of the heart which is the main part for pumping blood.
They learnt that as people grew old, there was an increase in faults in the relaxation of the heart.
Dr. Patricia says that as age increases, the faults in the relaxation of the heart begin to appear, and this affects the ability to exercise.
Dr. Garwin Cain was also a part of this study.
He says that we were surprised to see that there is a definite effect of this. And this clearly proves how deep a relation the worsening of exercise has with the relaxation of the heart.
Sometimes blood pressure can cause faults in the working of the heart and can become a cause of heart diseases.
If the doctor and the patient work together on the faults of the heart, they can achieve the benefits of excercise, despite the increase in age.
A detailed report of this has been published in the magazine of the American Medical Association.

hl.seg: There are no chances of an immediate war with Pakistan: Indian Army Chief.

doc.seg: The chief of the Indian Army, General Deepak Kapoor has stated that there are no chances of immediate war with Pakistan. However, to serve the country and protect its interests, they are always ready.

General Kapoor has made the accusation, that despite ascertainments and the international pressure on Pakistan due to the Mumbai attacks, in his words, the terrorists structure is not only just the same in Pakistan, but it is also active.
He said this in an interview to journalists in Srinagar.

The Indian Army Chief was on a one day trip to the Kashmir valley to inspect the situation of the overall security situation in Kashmir, which is under New Delhi's management and to check the preparations of the armed forces at the border.
He was asked as to what his reaction was to the media reports which state that Pakistan refuted the proof presented by India, about the Mumbai attacks.
He stated that the matters of peace and war are decided by the political leadership.
Mentioning the proven presence of a terrorism structure in Pakistan, he said that the Indian army would face such groups which are trying to disturb peace and are bent upon weakening India.
He said that in Indian Kashmir, at least 700 to 800 militants are present, of which approximately half are foreigners.

General Deepak Kapoor said that with an improvement in the seasonal weather, there might be an increase in infiltration from Pakistan and Pakistan Occupied Kashmir. However, India has increased the guard at the borders.
He refuted the possibility of decrease in the army posting in Kashmir, saying that there can be no compromise with regards to national security.

p.seg: May Allah bless the tongues of the world and may Barack become a blessing for the world.
Though it was not expected, still we shall see how this change will work out in our favor with regards to Pak-American relations.
And what Barack Obama, who is the result of Martin Luther Kings dreams, gives to the world.
Obama, part of whose name is Husain, taking the oath today, as the American President, is not only a matter of all sorts of historic importance, but also a historic test.
Not only for himself, but also for all the people who supported him.
It will even be a test for the white majority, as for them to accept from their hearts, a black governing over them is no easy task.

Those here in South Asia, especially the Muslims, who have hopes about him, should remember that he was elected the president of America, and Obama should remember that the president of America is actually the president of the world.

A little while from then, a person whose real brothers were brought to America from their own countries, wearing the neckband of slavery,and whose blood and sweat watered the roots of the strongest country of the new era, today the a representative of that very same targeted lineage will be called the 44th President.
Many people have many expectations from this man.
It is necessary for those who admire him that they do not make unrealistic expectations about him.
If Obama is even successful in somewhat reducing the hate that is spread on lineage and religion based lines, it will be a victory for his admirers.
What effect will this change have on South Asia, and what considerable change can be expected in the American policy in this regards?
How will these changes affect Pakistani-American relations?
My Sir, whether it be Obama or someone else, the type of policies with regards to the whole world is decided by the multi-billionaire, influential, strong Jewish lobby.
As for Pakistan, with regards to the recent Mumbai blasts, the injurious actions taken by India, Israel and America has been seen by the whole world.
Even for a while, after Pakistan was formed, the managing of Swat was left to the Ruler of Swat, which had it's own army and law.
They surrendered their rule to the government of Pakistan according to a treaty.
But it's sad that our governments have treated Swat like a step mother.
There has been no increase in the number of schools in Swat, since the rule of the Ruler of Swat was finished.
Nor was there any interest in the construction and development over there.
The number of girls receiving education in the present rule is many times less than their number in the previous rule.
In the Sarhad state of Pakistan, the local Taliban have been targeting the educational institutions.
The most schools were destroyed in Swat province, of which the majority were girls schools.
Not only this, but the Taliban have announced the prohibition of girls education in Swat.
Thousands of boy and girl students are being deprived of education.
What do you think the Taliban have to gain by eradicating female education?
Why has the government been unsuccessful in stopping these illegal steps?
What do you think the government should do?
The question should be, what does the ISI and Pakistani agencies get?

Because the public of Swat have realized this was a game, and that the army was there to serve the Taliban and not to kill them. Otherwise, how could five schools be blown up in a single curfew night? How could people be slaughtered during curfew and hung in the main circle of the town?
When the government is not being allowed to have any say in Swat, how can the government be successful in stopping these illegal steps?
Now, the question arises, as to when the government has an armed military, new and dangerous weapons, new technology and spy system etc., then why are these four Taliban not being controlled?
The answer to this is that they have the hand of a hidden guide on their heads, because of which neither do their weapons get exhausted, nor do they get captured.
The conclusion is that the Taliban, through there dark activities is making the work of the global leadership easier.
15 years ago, the war was on in Afghanistan.
ISI used to control the Taliban when there was the opposition from the Northern Alliance, which was supported by Russia, India and Iran.
Then, suddenly the situation changed and Taliban's works came to light.
And ISI also got an offer of Dollars from America, so the previous friend became an enemy.
Now the situation has changed but the war is still going on and those supporting them in Pakistan are still Russia, India and Iran.
Until man realizes what is wrong and what is right, he continues to make mistakes.
For instance, when a thief goes to steal something, if he realizes at that time that stealing is wrong, it is a curse and it will bring punishment, and he fears Allah, that person will not steal.

Similarly, as long as Israel does not realize that it is doing wrong, and spilling the blood of the innocent, and it will receive punishment for that, it will continue to play Holi with the blood of the innocent people in Gaza.
Greetings
The question is that, is war, armed resistance and terrorism the solution to problems?

In our family, most of the people are of the laborer type.
And in our childhood, when we used to see our uncles toil, we used to wish in our hearts that Allah save us from labor that is hard on the body.
To save ourselves from this, we wrote a letter to the editor of the Amroz daily, asking him what we can do after metric to save ourselves from having to toil.
The editor wrote in reply to become a doctor or engineer and take such and such subjects.
My focus was always on engineering, and after metric, instead of Biology, I took Technical Drawing.
But while entering the FSC, my elder brother forced me to do FSC in medicine and become a doctor.
I studied Biology for a month with great difficulty, and when I still could not understand anything, I took maths as a subject instead.
So the scare of having to work made me an engineer, and today I am in a very good condition compared to many of my same aged relatives, for which I am always thanking Allah.
I remembered this when I was trying to lift the carpet of my old house along with my two young sons.
It was not half an hour since we started working, that the younger son said "Dad, it looks as if I was not made for this job"
We said, if that is true, then study a lot like us, and free yourself from bodily pain.
The son said that I am studying and will continue studying, but I cannot do this work.
Anyway, the three of us finished that work in three hours and returned.
My purpose of saying this is that if a person has set a goal, whatever be the reason behind it, no one can stop him from achieving his goal.
But if you do not even know what you have to do, then Allah alone is your protector.

It is 37 years since East Pakistan was separated from us, and look at the height of insensitivity on the part of the public and the rulers, that no one ever mourned or expressed sorrow over their mistakes.
We should have been observing 16th December as a day of reflection, and made plans to prevent the re occurrence of such incidents.
We should have been sending greetings to the people of Bangladesh on this day and been trying to bring them closer to ourselves.
The ruler should have opened the Jamudur Rahman commission file and pondered over the causes of separation of West Pakistan, mentioned therein.
He would plan on bringing back the people of Bihar who were stuck in Bangladesh and he would send them gifts to keep their spirits up.
We have become so insensitive that if someone dies in our neighborhood, we are not even aware of it.
We do not care for our brothers and sisters because we have become selfish.
A huge calamity can pass by, but the next day we are lost in our day-to-day routine of life.
If only East and West Pakistan could become one again, like East and West Germany became one.
We can become one again, if we sacrifice a little for each other and leave our selfishness behind us.
But this wish does not look like it will be fulfilled in the near future.
Today, when it was announced in the news that the governor of American state Illinois was caught on corruption charges

and that he would soon be brought to account for removal from Governorship by the state congress, an American white friend of mine, who had deep insight into the situation in Pakistan, he told us, showing off, look this is called democracy.
In America, no gigantic figure is beyond the law.
And the other is your country, Pakistan, where even the President was chosen after the corruption charges against him were dropped.

My vein of loyalty throbbed and I said what is the big deal if a governor was arrested in America. In our Pakistan, once the Prime Minister was arrested and hanged overnight, and another time sent into exile.
Tell me, when did this happen in America?
In Pakistan, those who broke the law were sent out of the presidential palace with a guard of honor. Tell me when this happened in America.
The Chief Justice of Pakistan was removed in such a manner, that despite having public support, he could not be replaced until now. Has this happened in America?
In Pakistan, a fake-degree holder was made the Minister of Health. Did this happen in America?
Hearing this, the American laughed till he was tired and conceded defeat.
In this picture, President Zardari is smiling, despite being surrounded on all four sides by Americans.
It seems from his smile that
he thinks that America is with his government. He is forgetting that one year ago, they were with Pervez Musharraf.
This picture was passed on, as if it was of some family.
Previously, such a photo was never printed in newspapers before, i.e. one president with three American agents.
It seems as if America's work in Pakistan has increased and now more than one agent was needed to complete it, or that they did not trust the new slave as they trusted the first one.
It is also possible that this was done keeping in mind the notoriety of President Zardari breaking his promises.
If it was a smart ruler, at least he would not have shown his teeth in this photo, and he would have at least seemed ashamed of the neckband of slavery that he was sporting.
If the rules of democracy are implemented on this photo, President Zardari is in minority.
According to democracy, the majority are the rulers of the country, and the photo is speaking for itself who that is?

In Swat, the strongly affected part of Sarhad state, despite the continuity of military action for over one year, the situation is still going from bad to worse.

On one side, the government is only reiterating the passing of a reproachful resolution in the national assembly. On the other side, the Taliban's illegal radio FM channel is having much more influence in the region.
On the third side, the common man considers it safest to listen to the one who actually has control over the region.

During the action of the security forces, there were claims of destroying the fundamentalists by the bombing of gun ship helicopters and cannon houses, but despite these destructions, the Taliban only became more powerful, and according to an estimation, their control over Swat increased that much percent more.
As a result, on the one hand the government is not ready to accept defeat, and on the other hand the Taliban is stronger.
Who is stuck in between? The poor civilians.

It is said in Swat, that someone asked what kind of people are the Taliban were, so he got the answer, 'They are very good, as they are protectors of the religion and they fight against the enemies of Allah and the religion'.
Then he asked how the army was, so he got the answer, 'They are very good, as they are the protectors of the country and they fight against the enemies of the country'.
He then asked who the enemies of the religion and the country were, so he got the answer, 'We civilians'.
I am wondering how the Pakistani Army will fight the Indian Army, when they couldn't control a small faction of the Taliban.
They could not track the illegally set up FM channel of the Taliban, which I believe was very easy.
But still, the FM channel is spreading poison with all vigor.
After the girls schools, now boys schools are being destroyed.
Curfews are called so that the Taliban can move around easily.
During curfew tonight, eight trucks entered the outskirts of Mengorah and formed barriers.
The question arises as to how they got there despite the curfew.
The army could kill Akbar Bugti in his house, but salutes the Taliban.
For God's sake, can someone explain to the army to save the poor public from the grip of the Taliban and prove that the Army can defeat any enemy.
You say that mostly blood is spilled in the world because of religion. Tell me today, if there was no religion, would all this killing not take place?

At this time, including Derah Gahzi Khan, summer showers are taking place throughout the country.

These rains are also from you
which when fell brings spring.
When it stops there is no movement
sometimes it came just like that, without a reason.
Sometimes it spread day and night.
sometimes loudly, sometimes silently.
These rains are also from you
in some remembrance some night
on some suppressed ashes

Sometimes each drop seems sorrowful.

In our society, if the wife of a 50-55 year old man or the husband of such a wife passes away, why are they not looked at in a nice manner?
Near us, there is a Pakistani uncle, whose wife passed away 10-12 years ago. Now, after marrying off all his children, he has married a widow, so even his children have gone against him.
I believe this is his legitimate right. What do you say?
What type of mentality is the 'while we are there, no one can take our mother's place', kind of mentality?
I believe that this persons children should have thought what is wrong if he married a widow, after he married off all his children?
Thereby, this widow also got support and the uncle also got someone to look after the house.
As the children would definitely have gotten busy in their own worlds and would not be able to give time to him.
The reason for this is ignorance.
Tomorrow if their wives refuse to look after them, when they are old, what will they do?
This is a result of the force of society.
When people begin to make fun of such a family for doing something like that, children start to feel ashamed of their father's second marriage.
Though they should face the environment and say that their father's action is in perfect accordance with Islam.
This is the curse of our society, which we are facing for the last 40-50 years.
A wife can accept her husband going around having illicit relations, but she cannot stand him having a second wife.
If possible, stop him from doing so, even after you die.
She destroys her husband and her own hereafter, and becomes a cause for spreading filthiness in the society.
Chanting Islam, Islam does not mean anything. In reality, we like only our culture and traditions.
For instance keeping girls from gaining education and fearing marrying the girl of ones choice.

As for your question about the old man going to the widows house instead of bringing the widow to his house, so that the children could make some fuss and then become quiet and relax, (though the stomach of the widows children would hurt).
In the Indo Pak subcontinent, Islam was accepted centuries ago, but it could not yet leave its ignorant mentality and has always kept culture and tradition above Islam.

Thinking of a man's second marriage as an innovation, divorce as a clinical rest, divorced woman as untouchable, love marriage as a mark on honor and a man marrying a woman elder to him as a deception on the part of the wife, is all a part of this mentality.
What's more, in mimicry of the western countries, we have started to consider piety and veil as old fashioned.
Accepting Islam is easy, but leaving this mentality is very tough.
Allah bless us all the courage for it.
Amen.

Today, as I was returning to my shop, after Isha prayer, when a man sitting in a car at the circle raised his hand and diverted my attention towards him.
I thought this man might have lost his way, or he might want to ask something, so I stopped, and his whole family was sitting in the car.
He asked whether I could understand Arabic well or not. I said no problem, tell me what you want.

He started to say that I have come from Riyadh, to Madinah, but someone has pick-pocketed me, so please help me out. I asked him to excuse me, as such an incident had taken place with me previously, that I had given the person 20 Riyals to buy petrol to reach Riyadh, but he went a little ahead and started to ask somebody else.
I got very angry and scolded him and warned him that I would call the soldiers, so he got very frightened.
Now the situation has become, that we Muslims come on cars, with our families to beg throughout the day and gain at least two or three thousand illegally.
Whereas there is a clear Hadith of the Prophet (SAWS) that says that the upper hand is better than the lower hand; the lower hand being the begging hand and the upper hand being the giving one.
May Allah have mercy on us and make us true Muslims (Amen, Amen)
WasSalam
Jawed Iqbal

High ambassadors of America say that President Obama will take a strong stand against Afghan President Hamid Karzai.
In America's new policy for Afghanistan, instead of development, war has been given more importance.

The envoys say that Hamid Karzai is being considered a barrier in the achievement of American goals in Afghanistan, as there is corruption in the government and the business of middlemen has increased and the Taliban are once more gathering strength.

The American envoys say that among the people in the American government who are stressing upon Hamid Karzai to do something more are Vice President Joseph Biden and President Obama's representative to Afghanistan and Pakistan, Richard Hallbrooke.

He said that this policy appeared after President Bush, who used to video conference with Hamid Karzai every two weeks, left. He used to stress upon the American role in rebuilding Afghanistan and its civilian institutions.
Officials say that the Obama government would work with the State leaders rather than the central government.
The officials say that it will pressurize Karzai to step up the war against corruption.
Hamid Karzai is facing fresh elections this year, and it is not yet clear whether Obama and his group will support Karzai for presidency or not.
This statement of the American officials is not a precursor for a change in the American policy towards Afghanistan, is it?
Is Hamid Karzai's rule coming to an end?
